item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

There will be no General Public Comment today. If you wish to speak during the General Public Comment period, please submit a request to speak during public comment on Thursday or Friday’s agenda. If you wish to speak on a scheduled agenda item, please submit a speaker request.

RECEPTION. At the conclusion of the Commission meeting or 6:00 PM, whichever is later, on Wednesday, October 11, 2023, the Commission will attend a reception to be held at Sea180 Coastal Tavern located in the Pier South Resort at 800 Seacoast Drive, Imperial Beach, CA 91932. Members of the public are welcome to attend; however, because space is limited, those wishing to attend must make a reservation by email to info@oceanconnectors.org. Deadline to RSVP is Wednesday, October 4, 2023.

item_blurb: The Commission will take a field trip on the morning of Wednesday, October 11, to the Tijuana River Valley. After the call to order, roll call, and tribal acknowledgement, the Commission and field trip attendees will depart by vehicle from the meeting location to make several stops in the Tijuana River Valley to evaluate the ongoing trans-boundary pollution crisis. A limited number of members of the public will be able to attend with advance reservation on a first-come-first-served basis. If you are interested in reserving a place on the field trip, please contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources & Federal Consistency Division via email at EORFC@coastal.ca.gov with “RSVP” in the email subject line, no later than September 29, 2023.  A more detailed itinerary and guidance for attendees and public participants is provided.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Informational Briefing on the Trans-boundary Pollution Crisis in the Tijuana River and Tijuana River Valley.
subitem_blurb: Briefing on the status and impacts of the Tijuana River pollution crisis, including information on its environmental, public health and economic impacts in south San Diego County and the need for immediate action to help address it.

item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_blurb: Application for Orange County Parks to commence Phase 2 activities of an enhancement project for the targeted removal of non-native, invasive vegetation across 55.6 acres of the South Talbert Regional Park. Methods for removal include manual, mechanical, and chemical means. Following removal activities, reseeding with locally sourced native seeds and pole cuttings are proposed at the public park,1298 Victoria Street, Costa Mesa, Orange County. (ETP-LB)

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.
